meanings.definition: A large room containing many beds, typically in a boarding school or college.
meanings.sent1: The dormitory was filled with bunk beds for the students.
meanings.sent2: Students sleep in the dormitory during the school year.
meanings.sent3: The dormitory felt like a cozy sleepover with all the beds close together.
meanings.sent4: The dormitory was a hive of activity, each bed a busy worker bee.
meanings.sent5: The dormitory echoed with the sounds of students getting ready for bed.

meanings.definition: A building providing sleeping and residential quarters for a large number of people, typically students.
meanings.sent1: The new dormitory on campus can house over 200 students.
meanings.sent2: The dormitory has shared common areas for residents to socialize.
meanings.sent3: Living in the dormitory feels like being part of a big family.
meanings.sent4: The dormitory stood tall, a beacon of rest and community for students.
meanings.sent5: The lights in the dormitory windows twinkled like stars in the night sky.
